record.title: PARLIAMENTARY INQUIRY
record.chair: The gentleman will state his parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Madam Speaker, pursuant to the prior order of the House, would it be in order to call up H.R. 475 at this time?

record.chair: The order of the House provides that the bill may be brought up at any time.

speaking.paragraph: Madam Speaker, pursuant to the prior order of the House, regarding H.R. 475, is it correct that it allows for just 15 minutes of debate on each side, that is, 30 minutes total?

record.chair: The gentleman will state his further inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Is the Chair aware of any other legislative business that we are doing today?

record.chair: The gentleman has not stated a parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Is the Chair aware of any further legislative business that we are doing today?

record.chair: The Chair would advise the gentleman to consult the leaderships on that question.
The gentleman will state his inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: We do indeed understand the majority's desire to have a 5-day workweek, but is 30 minutes of work on a Friday considered a full day?

record.chair: The gentleman is not stating a parliamentary inquiry.

speaking.paragraph: Madam Speaker, I move to call up H.R. 475.

record.chair: Only a manager identified by the order of the House would be recognized to call up that bill.
